subject: RE: [junit] Re: Jwebunit Question
msgSnippet: Yeah It was a silly mistake. I forgot to add form in jsp page. Now it is working fine. I have just started working on JUnit & JWebUnit so I was learning it
messageBody:
Yeah It was a silly mistake.

I forgot to add form in jsp page.

Now it is working fine.



I have just started working on JUnit & JWebUnit so I was learning it
through this sample code.

Now I want some more stuff on JWebUnit fpr testing my jsp pages which
includes custom tags & everything...

How can we test in our web application.?



Please send me some material or code if anyone is having it.



Thanks,

Richa.



________________________________

From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
Sent: Monday, November 14, 2005 11:31 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Jwebunit Question



richa_gwrl wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am new to JWebUnit & trying to use it for my jsp pages.
> But I am getting "AssertionFailedError" with message "No form
> present."
> I m using following code lines to set page & form elemnts method:
>
> getTestContext().setBaseUrl("http://localhost:8080/test");
>
> beginAt("sample.jsp");
>
> assertFormElementPresent("login");
>
> any help would be highly appreciated.
>
> I m not having any good stuff on this topic so I can't do any R&D
> for the code...

Does sample.jsp really have a form named "login"? If not, then the test
correctly fails.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
